shuttle.desc: Though shuttlecraft are usually used to ferry goods between ships, or save larger ships from needing to enter atmosphere, some shuttlecraft are equipped with jump drives and used as extremely cheap merchant ships. The model manufactured now has been frozen since its development by the shipwrights of Accra in the year 407. You can get parts for it basically anywhere and it is considered very reliable. Just don't try and take it into combat - or try to takeoff with more than 10 tons in the cargo bay.

civ_heavy_fighter.desc: One of the few starfighters actually suitable for a trader pilot, the Heavy Fighter has decent cargo room and expansion space, and fuel scoops, originally designed to support its pair of lasers, but able to extend its range as a cargo trader as well. Also a favorite among bounty hunters, and (as some might mention) pirates.

courier.desc: This is actually the smallest vessel offered by Accra Starworks, and a very popular one for up and coming merchents. While it has ample cargo bays, it does not sacrifice too much performance, allowing captains to get out of trouble if need be.

argosy.desc: Designed to run dangerous cargo routes by upstart starship maker Khanda, the Argosy is a mix power and trade efficiency. It will fight like a frigate in a pinch and can carry enough cargo to make the fight worth your while. A version is even used by the League navy

bulk.desc: Designed for safe cargo routes, or to fly under escort, the Bulk Freighter is a gigantic cousin of the shuttle. Often cited as a case of Accra selling out, it is the favorite of peaceful merchants who enjoy well polieced routes, and of pirates who enjoy easy prey.

oxana.full_name: Meklin Design Bureau Oxana class Freighter
oxana.desc: One of the better cargo ships in the universe, it sports a battery of engines and a decent protection suite. It is Meklin's best selling offering, though rumors abound that it is sold at a loss to hide profits from the League. It has a huge cargo bay, but also enough room for some armament.

vera.full_name: Meklin Design Bureau Vera class Escort Frigate
vera.desc: You could say that the Vera is a compromise between raw power and elegance, but that would be selling the Melkin design bearu short. One of the best ships on the civilian market, traders and mercinaries alike salivate over the prospect of flying one of these monsters.

pertinax.full_name: Caudron Custom Starships Pertinax Heavy Frigate
pertinax.desc: Built off of Melkin's famous Vera class, the Pertinax is specialized for piracy, packing dragnet turrets and ion cannons. Probably the most feared pirate ship in the galaxy.

cetacea.desc: The largest Freighter currently on the market, the Catacea is a wonder of engieneering. Several exotic metals and alloys are required to prevent it from being ripped apart not only when accelerating, but under its own gravity.

civ_corvette.desc: The Corvette's power-to-weight ratio is its greatest strength-it is built fight aggressively. It can avoid being swarmed by fighters while still packing enough punch to take on larger ships.

cas_corvette.full_name: Accra Starworks Type 991 Ausf. B Main Battle Starship
cas_corvette.desc: Based on an experimental design from the closing years of the empire, this is the Casamance Directorate's most common fighting starship. It serves many roles, from patrol to attack, all reasonably well.

cas_oe_fighter.desc: Basically, this is a repainted Old Empire Type 950, barely improved with more modern weapons. It is a point of pride in the Casamance Directorate to still run these ships, and what they lack in power is made up for in numbers. And the build quality of Accra Starworks is certainly better than the dodgy backwater shipyards that crank out the more common variant.

cas_frigate.full_name: Accrs Starworks Type 1123 Ausf. R Frigate

cas_carrier.full_name: Accra Starworks Type 1125 Ausf. B Battleship
cas_carrier.desc: Accra produces one true warship, and this is it. Modeled after the Type 930, the 1125 is larger, slower, and able to carry more fighters into battle.

oe_fighter.desc: Nearly Identical to the ships that swamred across the sector a generation ago, this is the starfighter version of the Emperial Fighter. The "Starfighter" desegnation is to make it clear that this ship is capable of FTL travel-not always the rule for ships its size. In its day, its linear aerospike engines (now a common sight) where a revelation. Its large wings offer a gentle landing for novice pilots, but don't be fooled-this no trainer. It's built to be as much an aircraft as it is a spacecraft. Ubiquitous, they are now manufactured (or repaired and resold) on most worlds.

oe_frig.desc: This tall craft has been in service from generations, and was once a cutting edge warship. It is now available in many variants to the public, though this is the Type 925 version, with its original armament of plasma cannons and complament of fighters. Though its shields are somewhat lacking compared with modern ships, its hull is thick and its cargo bay-once used to carry shuttles full of soldiers into battle against rebellious worlds-more than capable of cargo runs of today.

oe_cru.desc: Once the most feared ship class in the galaxy, the Emperial Battlecruiser is still a sight to behold. It can carry an entire wing of Emperial Fighters, as well as its broadside battery of plasma weaponry. It was able to carry enough supplies to support extended voyages into enemy space. It was able to lay siege to entire star systems, owing to the fact that many of the star systems had only rudimentary spaceflight and no ability to shoot down orbital targets.

xic_drillship.desc: This ship goes on long missions for XIC, carrying wings of ships that manage the asteroid chunks as the drillship breaks asteroids up. It has through-and-through engines, essentially similar to those of an OE fighter but simpler with an eye towards power generation rather than speed. Its internal docking ring protects fighters from harsher bouts with microasteroids.

xic_prospector.desc: These ships fly out to mine asteroids, and ostensably aren't meant for combat. However, those who try to make a play for mining rights to a rock that XIC has its eye on may meet with an unfortunate industrial accident.

itaska_deathcap.desc: The enormous Battleship is the last resort of the seventh fleet. Its rarity only adds to its renown, with rumors about its power and size abound. What is known for sure is that it isn't seen launching fighters, but rather charges into battle with distressing speed, shredding enemey ships to pieces, then retreating back out of the system.

itaska_hemlock.full_name: Willakanuta Space Command F14 "Hemlock" light frigate
itaska_hemlock.desc: The Willakanuta argue that they do not risk pilots in fighters-the smallest ship that they use for battle (and patrol) is the F14. It is one of the most commonly seen WSC ships, used for recon, patrol, and fleet support.

itaska_nightshade.desc: Easily one of the most powerful ships in the galaxy,the Nightshade is the power of a cruiser packed into a ship the size of a corvette.

league_sparrow.desc: A smaller and more nimble version of the retired Sparrow, manufactured specifically for the Leauge navy. Variants of this ship make up the entire Leauge fighter corps. It is the main contribution of the FuHao the League technology sharing agreement.

league_heavy_fighter.desc: The league version of Khanda's heavy fighter incorporates some fairly interesting technology from Melkin and FuHao.

league_corvette.desc: This is the league upgrade of the Kalvari, a small but fast and powerful starship. It is flexable, used for both partol missions and dangerous raids behind enemey lines. A favorite of the League's special services division, or so they say.

league_argosy.desc: Upgunned, this version argosy is closer to a battleship than a cargo ship. But besides the livery and missile racks, this is similar to the commercial version in most respects. Call it a trim level.

league_warship.full_name: Meklin Design Bureau Oxana class cargo ship (League Carrier Variant)
league_warship.desc: A masterpiece of economy, the Oxana class is normally manufactured as a high-end cargo ship. However its enormous internal volume lends itself more so then other haulers of similar size to conversion into a carrier. This variant's internal cargo hold has been replaced by a stack of flight decks, and it is stocked with fighters and corvettes. Its armor has been thickened as well, to better deal with the punishing power of Loyalist antimatter weaponry.

ff_oe_fighter.desc: The fifth fleet's T950 variant is nearly identical to the one still manufactured across former empire worlds, as it is based on a late prototype, armed with then-new antimatter weapons. It retains many benifits of the beloved '50 including its speed, though It cannot match the raw power of a NE Type 1153, or the speed of a League sparrow.

ff_oe_frig.desc: As with most fifth fleet technology, their variant of the battleship is based on prototypes developed near the end of the empire, not yet ready for full production but under testing by the eliete Fifth Fleet. It has been modified for longer-range missions, originally intended to strike at the heart of Itaskan space but now used to execute raids on the League and Loyal Suns.

ff_oe_cru.desc: This is the obvious upgrade of the 930 Battlecruiser, carrying improved fighters and weapons. Enormous amounts of resources are expended on these ships, and they are not easily replaced by the resource-strapped fifth fleet.

ff_oe_corvette.desc: An innovative design that came too late to be immortalized by the devotion of hundreds of factories, the 991 corvette was arguably the first such ship, with the long operational range of a scout fighter and some of a battleship's punch. Though the shortage of tooling will always make it a less common sight than the fighters or cruisers, it is often seen providing support for wings of fighters. Only the best pilots are allowed to risk these ships in battle, and their combat record reflects this.

ne_heavyfi.full_name: Loyal Suns Heavy Starfighter Type 1153 rev C
ne_heavyfi.desc: The Thunder is the legendary staple fighter of the Northern Empire, known and respected across the sector. There is a direct and obvious line between the OE fighter and this ship, with similar intake ramscoops and essentially the same rocket engines, just scaled up. Many describe it as "the OE fighter, perfected.", but there are of course some tradeoffs. It isn't quite as nimble and it's quite a bit more expensive and takes up more room on a flight deck, so they can't field as many. And there is certainly a smaller back-stock of parts, engieneers feeling less constrained to maintain compatability with generations-old designs.

neVette.desc: Designed to work in concert with the generally lighter and more agile (both tactically and strategiclly) fleets of the Northern Empire, the Nimbus is a multi-role ship, making dangerous supply runs, bringing additional heat in firefights, and running back-water patrols.

nebattleship.desc: This new and very modern warship is designed along the lines of a fighter rather than a frigate. There's something ideological here, the primacy of the starship pilot, of visceral combat, that gets at the heart of the Loyalist psyche. It's the largest ship in the galaxy where the captain's chair is also the pilot's seat. Its self sufficiency, another doctrinal holdover from conquering uncontacted planets, is key to its success; they can operate totally independandly of the rest of the fleet, and support wings of deep-striking heavy fighters.

necruiser.desc: The enormous Loyal Suns battlecruiser was built to replace the aging fleet of type 930s, which where barely large enough to accomodate the new heavy fighters. Though heavy fighters and battleships can operate deep in enemey territory for extended periods, the value of having a home base and firebase has been long recognized. Unfortunately, the price tag on an Absolver has scaled up with the size, and very few have been launched, which has drawn criticisim when it is compared to the widely deployed League carrier. The designers, however, maintain that this ship is in a tier of its own, and should not be compared to the vastly converted freighter. The Supreme Comissar of the Loyal Suns fleet herself commands one of these monsters, as does the Lord Clone himself.

caudron_sparrow.desc: Somehow the caudron cartel got a hold of the tooling to make sparrows deep in the nebula, and the results are slick.

pirate_ahab.desc: One of these could probably cow many ships by size alone. A modified Cetacea chassis, the main thing it has in common with the ship that was originally launched is its enormousness. Pirates will try and upgun anything, but the Ahab probably takes the cake as far as "most guns and armor stuffed onto a freighter." Unlike, say, the Sleeper, the Ahab build makes zero attempt to hide its true nature. And on a ship mounting so many dragnets, there is little need to.

caudron_corvette.desc: The cartel's (supposedly liscensed) copy of the Kalvari is often the last thing seen by those who owe money to the Caudrons.

patsy.desc: Just because you can fly around in an upgunned shuttlecraft does not mean it's a very good idea. For the pirate with more bravery than good sense. Life insurance not included.

pirate_sleeper.desc: Faster than it looks, tougher than it looks, and of course deadlier than it looks. Many a captain has been lured in by the benign appearance of a courier only to be surprise-attacked by one of these.

triggerman.desc: Of course pirates would use a ship designed to fight pirates. A cruel irony. A fine ship as well, though more of a sidegrade than an upgrade, this removes the pretense of a trading ship altogether, sacrificing cargo capacity for raw power..
